body_html:
Just chiming in to say that a GPU-friendly sort function would enable efficient projection oracles for the l1-ball and simplex (http://icml2008.cs.helsinki.fi/papers/361.pdf), which would in turn make TensorFlow useful for a wide range of large-scale constrained optimization problems beyond deep learning. This and some other efficient projection oracles (e.g. l2) could maybe be rolled into ProximalGradientDescentOptimizer long-term? (as projection is a proximal operator)

Also, issue #5719 which is a feature request for GPU-enabled topK is related. Maybe these can be handled at the same time?
